content:
DataGridBoolColumn Class

Definition

Specifies a column in which each cell contains a check box for representing a Boolean value.

In this Article

public class DataGridBoolColumn : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle
Inheritance
Object
MarshalByRefObject
Component

DataGridBoolColumn

Remarks

The DataGridBoolColumn derives from the abstract class DataGridColumnStyle. At run time, the DataGridBoolColumn contains check boxes in each cell that have three states by default: checked (true), unchecked (false), and Value. To use two-state check boxes, set the AllowNull property to false.

Properties added to the class include FalseValue, NullValue, and TrueValue. These properties specify the value underlying each of the column's states.

Constructors

DataGridBoolColumn()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridBoolColumn class.

public DataGridBoolColumn ();

Remarks

When using this overload to create a DataGridBoolColumn, be sure to set the MappingName value to the ColumnName of a DataColumn.

DataGridBoolColumn(PropertyDescriptor)

Initializes a new instance of a DataGridBoolColumn with the specified PropertyDescriptor.

public DataGridBoolColumn (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor prop);
prop
PropertyDescriptor

The PropertyDescriptor associated with the column.

Remarks

The DataGridBoolColumn must be associated with a data source that contains Boolean values.

To get a PropertyDescriptor, first use the BindingContext to return the appropriate BindingManagerBase. Then use the GetItemProperties method of the BindingManagerBase to return a PropertyDescriptorCollection. Finally, use the Item property of the PropertyDescriptorCollection to return the specific PropertyDescriptor for the column.

DataGridBoolColumn(PropertyDescriptor,Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of a DataGridBoolColumn with the specified PropertyDescriptor, and specifying whether the column style is a default column.

public DataGridBoolColumn (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor prop, bool isDefault);
prop
PropertyDescriptor

The PropertyDescriptor associated with the column.

isDefault
Boolean

true to specify the column as the default; otherwise, false.

Remarks

To get a PropertyDescriptor, first use the BindingContext to return the appropriate BindingManagerBase. Then use the GetItemProperties method of the BindingManagerBase to return a PropertyDescriptorCollection. Finally, use the Item property of the PropertyDescriptorCollection to return the specific PropertyDescriptor for the column.

Properties

AllowNull

Gets or sets a value indicating whether null values are allowed.

public bool AllowNull { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if null values are allowed, otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

When this property is set to false, the check boxes in the column have only two states: checked (true) and unchecked (false).

FalseValue

Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to false.

public object FalseValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

The value, typed as Object.

Remarks

The FalseValue, NullValue, and TrueValue properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.

NullValue

Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to Value.

public object NullValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

The value, typed as Object.

Remarks

You can also specify what text will be displayed by setting the NullText property.

The AllowNull property must be set to true to enter null values.

The FalseValue, NullValue, and TrueValue properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.

TrueValue

Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to true.

public object TrueValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

The value, typed as Object.

Remarks

The FalseValue, NullValue, and TrueValue properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.

Methods

Abort(Int32)

Initiates a request to interrupt an edit procedure.

protected override void Abort (int rowNum);
rowNum
Int32

The number of the row in which an operation is being interrupted.

Commit(CurrencyManager,Int32)

Initiates a request to complete an editing procedure.

protected override bool Commit (System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager dataSource, int rowNum);
dataSource
CurrencyManager

The DataView of the edited column.

rowNum
Int32

The number of the edited row.

Returns
Boolean

true if the editing procedure committed successfully; otherwise, false.

ConcedeFocus()

Notifies a column that it must relinquish the focus to the control it is hosting.

protected override void ConcedeFocus ();

Edit(CurrencyManager,Int32,Rectangle,Boolean,String,Boolean)

Prepares the cell for editing a value.

protected override void Edit (System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager source, int rowNum, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, bool readOnly, string displayText, bool cellIsVisible);
source
CurrencyManager

The DataView of the edited cell.

rowNum
Int32

The row number of the edited cell.

bounds
Rectangle

The Rectangle in which the control is to be sited.

readOnly
Boolean

true if the value is read only; otherwise, false.

displayText
String

The text to display in the cell.

cellIsVisible
Boolean

true to show the cell; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Unlike the typical implementation of this method (as described in the DataGridColumnStyle class), the Edit method does not site a control for editing the cell value. Instead, a check box is drawn when the Paint method is called.

EnterNullValue()

Enters a Value into the column.

protected override void EnterNullValue ();
Exceptions
Exception

The stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull* property is set to false.

Remarks

To set the actual value used when entering a null value, use the NullValue property.

GetColumnValueAtRow(CurrencyManager,Int32)

Gets the value at the specified row.

protected override object GetColumnValueAtRow (System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager lm, int row);
lm
CurrencyManager

The CurrencyManager for the column.

row
Int32

The row number.

Returns
Object

The value, typed as Object.

GetMinimumHeight()

Gets the height of a cell in a column.

protected override int GetMinimumHeight ();
Returns
Int32

The height of the column. The default is 16.

GetPreferredHeight(Graphics,Object)

Gets the height used when resizing columns.

protected override int GetPreferredHeight (System.Drawing.Graphics g, object value);
g
Graphics

A Graphics that draws on the screen.

value
Object

An Object that contains the value to be drawn to the screen.

Returns
Int32

The height used to automatically resize cells in a column.

GetPreferredSize(Graphics,Object)

Gets the optimum width and height of a cell given a specific value to contain.

protected override System.Drawing.Size GetPreferredSize (System.Drawing.Graphics g, object value);
g
Graphics

A Graphics that draws the cell.

value
Object

The value that must fit in the cell.

Returns
Size

A Size that contains the drawing information for the cell.

Remarks

The GetPreferredSize method allows you to resize the column based on the value displayed. For example, if a cell contains an especially large value, you can use the GetPreferredSize method to return the optimum size of the cell based on the value. The optimum size takes into account not only the size of the string, but also the font used to display it.

Paint(Graphics,Rectangle,CurrencyManager,Int32)

Draws the DataGridBoolColumn with the given Graphics, Rectangle and row number.

protected override void Paint (System.Drawing.Graphics g, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager source, int rowNum);
g
Graphics

The Graphics to draw to.

bounds
Rectangle

The bounding Rectangle to paint into.

source
CurrencyManager

The CurrencyManager of the column.

rowNum
Int32

The number of the row referred to in the underlying data.

Remarks

This method paints the background with the background color in the graphics object passed in.

Paint(Graphics,Rectangle,CurrencyManager,Int32,Boolean)

Draws the DataGridBoolColumn with the given Graphics, Rectangle, row number, and alignment settings.

protected override void Paint (System.Drawing.Graphics g, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager source, int rowNum, bool alignToRight);
g
Graphics

The Graphics to draw to.

bounds
Rectangle

The bounding Rectangle to paint into.

source
CurrencyManager

The CurrencyManager of the column.

rowNum
Int32

The number of the row in the underlying data table being referred to.

alignToRight
Boolean

A value indicating whether to align the content to the right. true if the content is aligned to the right, otherwise, false.

Paint(Graphics,Rectangle,CurrencyManager,Int32,Brush,Brush,Boolean)

Draws the DataGridBoolColumn with the given Graphics, Rectangle, row number, Brush, and Color.

protected override void Paint (System.Drawing.Graphics g, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager source, int rowNum, System.Drawing.Brush backBrush, System.Drawing.Brush foreBrush, bool alignToRight);
g
Graphics

The Graphics to draw to.

bounds
Rectangle

The bounding Rectangle to paint into.

source
CurrencyManager

The CurrencyManager of the column.

rowNum
Int32

The number of the row in the underlying data table being referred to.

backBrush
Brush

A Brush used to paint the background color.

foreBrush
Brush

A Color used to paint the foreground color.

alignToRight
Boolean

A value indicating whether to align the content to the right. true if the content is aligned to the right, otherwise, false.

Remarks

Paints the check box in the column.

SetColumnValueAtRow(CurrencyManager,Int32,Object)

Sets the value of a specified row.

protected override void SetColumnValueAtRow (System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager lm, int row, object value);
lm
CurrencyManager

The CurrencyManager for the column.

row
Int32

The row number.

value
Object

The value to set, typed as Object.

Events

AllowNullChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull* property is changed.

public event EventHandler AllowNullChanged;

FalseValueChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue* property is changed.

public event EventHandler FalseValueChanged;

TrueValueChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue* property value is changed.

public event EventHandler TrueValueChanged;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.
